document.docTitle: Tetranychus misumaiensis Ehara & Gotoh, 2007, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: Five species of spider mites (Acari: Prostigmata: Tetranychidae) from Japan with descriptions of two new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Five species of spider mites (Acari: Prostigmata: Tetranychidae) from Japan with descriptions of two new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Numbers of setae and solenidia (in parentheses) on leg segments: coxae 2 - 2 - 1 - 1 , trochanters 1 - 1 - 1 - 1 , femora
10 - 6 - 4 - 4
, genua 5 - 5 - 4 - 4 , tibiae 9 ( 1 )- 7 - 6-7 , tarsi 13 ( 1 )+ 2 dupl.- 13 ( 1 )+ 1 dupl.- 9 ( 1 )- 10 ( 1 ). Tarsus I with 4 tactile setae proximal to proximal set of duplex setae, and 1 solenidion at level of proximal duplex setae (
Fig. 30
); tarsus II with 3 tactile setae and 1 solenidion proximal to duplex setae (
Fig. 31
). Empodia with minute mediodorsal spur and 3 pairs of proximoventral hairs.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 25–33.
Tetranychus misumaiensis
n. sp.
25, distal segment of palpus (female); 26, distal segment of palpus (male); 27, peritreme (female); 28–29, aedeagi; 30, tarsus and tibia I (female); 31, tarsus and tibia II (female); 32, tarsus and tibia I (male, holotype), with enlarged empodium I (schematic); 33, tarsus and tibia II (male).

Type series.
Holotype male (NSMT-Ac 12453 ): Misumai, Sapporo, Hokkaido,
23 Sept. 2005
(T. Gotoh leg.), on
Apios
sp. ( Fabaceae ). Paratypes :
5 males
(NSMT-Ac 12454-12458 ) &
10 females
(NSMT-Ac 12459- 12460 ),
4 males
&
8 females
(KUM), data same as for holotype .

Remarks. The new species is assigned to Flechtmann & Knihinicki’s ( 2002 ) Group 9 of
Tetranychus
. The aedeagus of this species resembles that of
T. ferrandezi
Baker & Pritchard, 1962
from Costa Rica . However, the anterior tip of its terminal knob is acutely angulate, while in
ferrandezi
the tip is widely rounded (
Baker & Pritchard, 1962
).
Etymology. This species is named after the type locality, Misumai.
